executive_summary: Revenue for business service centers has been volatile during the current period. When COVID-19 hit, demand for the industry's services was constrained by the shutdown of many physical service centers and falling corporate profit. Despite this, soaring e-commerce sales boosted demand from retailers and other sellers of goods and services, causing revenue to rise in 2020. As the economy recovered from the pandemic, e-commerce sales plunged, damaging the industry's performance. As higher corporate profit slowly raised investment from businesses, revenue rose in 2022. Rising interest rates have constrained consumer spending, heightening recessionary fears. These fears have caused more businesses to save more money for a rainy day, hindering spending on the industry's services.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: When the pandemic hit, state and local governments imposed lockdowns and enforced stringent social distancing measures. Many business service centers closed their doors in response to these measures, causing providers to operate completely online. Demand for services typically provided in-person, such as printing, declined.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Industry's Performance Has Been Volatile Since The End Of The Pandemic
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Despite the US economy recovering in 2021 as retailers, restaurants, manufacturing plants and other businesses reopened, revenue didn't increase as falling e-commerce sales as a result of the end of the pandemic constrained the industry's performance.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Business Service Centers Have Been Subject To Increased Internal And External Competition
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Businesses have had to contend with mounting pressure to move their activities online, endangering some service providers.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Steady economic conditions will boost the industry's performance
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Despite challenges related to rising interest rates, high inflation and recessionary fears, the US economy is expected to perform well during the outlook period.

industry_definition: The industry provides mailbox rental and other postal and mailing services (except direct-mail advertising). Establishments that provide these mailing services along with one or more other office support services, such as facsimile services, word-processing services, on-site PC rental services and office product sales, are included in the industry.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: low - steady

key_trends: The level of internal competition is high and growing.
Factors related to the growth of digital communication and the possibility of conducting business online have threatened business service centers.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Numerous office support services are used by small businesses, including copying and mailing services for packages.
For different occasions and events, such as making flyers or invitations and mailing gift packages for special occasions.

products_and_services.product_description: Duplicating text, sketches, plans, maps and other materials using blueprinting, photocopying.
Providing private postal services, shipping and mailing services and private mailboxes to customers.

tier_1_suppliers: Copier & Office Equipment Wholesaling in the US
Computer & Packaged Software Wholesaling in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Office Stationery Manufacturing in the US
tier_1_buyers: E-Commerce & Online Auctions in the US
tier_2_buyers: Finance and Insurance in the US
Healthcare and Social Assistance in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Business service centers serve a range of downstream clients.
Revenue generated from client businesses is typically outsourced.

business_locations.location_description: Many businesses and start-ups have chosen to locate in cities such as Atlanta, Charlotte and Nashville.
The West region is home to the manufacturing, biotechnology, energy, agriculture and food processing sectors.

regulations_points.regulation_description: While licensing in this industry is fairly low in general, most states require providers to receive a basic business license.
The Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) is tasked with ensuring safe working conditions.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Most business service centers are not explicitly governed by industry-specific regulations.

basis_points.basis_title: Competition based on delivery time and price
basis_points.basis_description: Companies compete based on delivery time, range of services and price.

concentration_points.concentration_title: High internal competition fosters low market share concentration
concentration_points.concentration_description: There's no dominant company or group of players controlling a significant share of the market.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: PURCHASE COSTS ARE HELD STEADY BY PREEXISTING CONTRACTS
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchases include paper, ink, office supplies and printing equipment.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Capital expenditures include furniture, computers, hardware and communication systems.

volatility_points.volatility_title: OVERALL ECONOMIC STRENGTH INFLUENCES THE INDUSTRY'S PERFORMANCE

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: VIRTUAL OFFICE SERVICES HAVE CONSTRAINED MARKET SHARE CONCENTRATION
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Virtual office services have become widely available due to the adoption of the Internet.

FAQs.question: Has the trend in business outsourcing positively impacted your company? Do you see this trend continuing in the future?
FAQs.answer: The trend toward outsourcing has positively impacted business service centers as a growing number of businesses have moved toward hiring their services.
